intro: Crotalaria linkiana, commonly known as the African velvet bean, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with distinctive black markings, and its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets. Crotalaria linkiana is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of climates. It is also used in traditional medicine and as a forage crop in some regions.
